TableContextTimeStampAfterTable: {7415=Arthur “Monkey” Joseph Gould (centre/fullback) - called "Monkey" because of childhood passion of climbing trees. Captained Newport Juniors at age 14yrs and played for Newport 3rds 1878/9. Debut age 18 yrs Nov 18th 1882 vs Weston Super Mare at RP (W 1g 2t to 0) - had played for 3rd XV and was late rep for regular fullback – ran in 2 tries. Most Welsh capped centre until Steve Fenwick (Bridgend) at Lansdowne Rd on 15th March 1980. 27 Welsh caps (2 at fullback / 25 at centre) - debut vs England on 3rdJan 1885 and last vs England on 9th Jan 1897 – played in front of 17,000 at R P and Wales won 11-0. It was 18th time Gould had captained Wales. Record stood until 1994 (Ieuan Evans)., 8163=Played for Newport 1882/3-1898/9.In 1892/3 scored 37 t* / 4dg / 5c ( try club record still stands). * Also scored 2 in friendly match. Captained Wales 4 times in 1889 -1890., 9664=Newport RFC record : 1882/3-1898/9 : 231 apps / 159t / 66c / 61 dg / 1p., 8352=Spent year in West Indies. Returned for invincible 1891/2 season. In 1892/3 only 3 games lost and captained Newport in 1893/4 (L3) and 1894/5 (lost only to Llanelli A 6-8). Retired in 1896 but persuaded to return and in Jan 1897 made 27th app for Wales and captained them to 11-0 win vs England at Newport. Played also for Richmond (once vs Newport but on losing side!), Southampton Titans and London Welsh incl their first ever fixture in Oct 1885 vs London Scottish when he played fullback. Superb all round player / even time sprinter with swerve, side-step / kick with either foot. Never ceased to practise to develop his fitness and skills. The outstanding player of his time. On Easter Monday 1897 Sir John Llewellyn, President of WRU presented him with title deeds of Thornbury, No 6 Llanthewy Rd, Clytha Park. Arthur Gould Memorial Bed in Royal Gwent: “To the memory of Arthur Gould – Greatest of Rugby Football Players” no longer there (in part of hospital since demolished). Took up refereeing after he retired., 155036=Sunday August 30th 2015 at CAP, 9766=There was at least one of 6 brothers in Newport’s team for first 29 seasons and Wyatt played until 1907 but not in 1904/5., 157936=Copyright © Newport Rugby Football Club 2015. All rights reserved., 157847=Tel: 01633 670 690 Fax: 01633 670 696 Tickets: 01633 674 990, 154705=Draw for 7's at CAP - B&A's up against RGC 1404, 9389=Died 2nd Jan 1919 Age 54. Taken ill at work and rushed home. Died of internal haemorrhage and funeral reported as biggest ever seen in Wales – until ca 30yrs later when David Lloyd George died. Buried at St Woolos Cemetery. Brewer’s agent at Phillips Brewery.}
